The Inca tern is a uniquely plumaged bird that breeds on the coasts of Peru and Chile. It can be identified by its dark grey body, white moustache on both sides of its head, and red-orange beak and feet

item.title:
The amount of water stored in more than half of the largest lakes and reservoirs worldwide is declining, a new Science study finds.
The results underscore the importance of better water management to protect essential ecosystem services. https://t.co/UizPMVH1WS https://t.co/aIKeTlVM6M

item.title:
@KordingLab @_fernando_rosas @ProfLaurenRoss Neurons are not molecules of a gas, that's for sure.
If similar approaches won't get to some insights about the brain it's difficult to say. Statistical physics has provided a very powerful framework for many Complex problems, to date.

item.title: We replace the affine function over each polytope populated by the training data with a Gaussian kernel learned using the training data and prune the unpopulated polytopes. We call the proposed approach Kernel Generative Forest (KGF) and Kernel Generative Network (KGN). 8/12
item.description: We replace the affine function over each polytope populated by the training data with a Gaussian kernel learned using the training data and prune the unpopulated polytopes. We call the proposed approach Kernel Generative Forest (KGF) and Kernel Generative Network (KGN). 8/12
item.content:encoded: We replace the affine function over each polytope populated by the training data with a Gaussian kernel learned using the training data and prune the unpopulated polytopes. We call the proposed approach Kernel Generative Forest (KGF) and Kernel Generative Network (KGN). 8/12

item.title: ğŸ¥¼ The collaboration to create iGluSnFR3 began when @abhi_aggarwal1 came to Janelia in 2019 as a Janelia Undergraduate Scholar. @PodgorskiLab, who was a Janelia Fellow, had recently embarked on a project to devise a genetically encoded indicator to measure glutamate. (2/9)
item.description: ğŸ¥¼ The collaboration to create iGluSnFR3 began when @abhi_aggarwal1 came to Janelia in 2019 as a Janelia Undergraduate Scholar. @PodgorskiLab, who was a Janelia Fellow, had recently embarked on a project to devise a genetically encoded indicator to measure glutamate. (2/9)
item.content:encoded: ğŸ¥¼ The collaboration to create iGluSnFR3 began when @abhi_aggarwal1 came to Janelia in 2019 as a Janelia Undergraduate Scholar. @PodgorskiLab, who was a Janelia Fellow, had recently embarked on a project to devise a genetically encoded indicator to measure glutamate. (2/9)

item.title: ğŸ§ Glutamate is one of the most important and abundant neurotransmitters in the brain. Being able to see and measure glutamate could help scientists understand how neurons communicate and transform inputs into outputs to perform computations. (3/9)
